params.textField:
The bodies which provide the light naturally are called *natural* sources of light.
The bodies which provide the light artificially are called *artificial* sources of light.

questions: The type of spherical mirror shown in the figure is *convex/Convex* mirror.

params.taskDescription: Drag the words into the correct boxes.
params.resetDropDescription: Are you sure you want to reset this drop zone?

params.textField:
An image that can be obtained on a screen is called *real image*. 
A *real image* is formed by the actual intersection of reflected or refracted rays.
An image that cannot be obtained on a screen is called *virtual image*. 
A *virtual image* is formed by the apparent intersection of rays.

params.question: The type of beam of light shown in the figure is divergent beam. Is it true or false?

params.taskDescription: Drag the words into the correct boxes.
params.resetDropDescription: Are you sure you want to reset this drop zone?
params.a11yCheck: Check the answers. The responses will be marked as correct, incorrect, or unanswered.

params.textField:
The centre of a curved mirror is called *pole*.
The line passing through the pole and centre of curvature of mirror is called *principal axis*.
The point on a *principal axis* a mirror at which a parallel beam of light is converged by mirror or diverged is called *principal focus*.
The distance between the pole and focus of mirror is called *focal length*.

questions: The type of spherical mirror shown in the figure is *concave/Concave* mirror.

params.taskDescription: Drag the words into the correct boxes.
params.resetDropDescription: Are you sure you want to reset this drop zone?
params.a11yCheck: Check the answers. The responses will be marked as correct, incorrect, or unanswered.
params.a11yShowSolution: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.
params.a11yRetry: Retry the task. Reset all responses and start the task over again.
params.textField:
A *concave mirror* changes a parallel beam of light into a converging beam.
A *concave mirror* is also called a converging mirror.
A *convex mirror* changes a parallel beam of light into a diverging beam of light.
A *convex mirror* is also called a  diverging mirror.
